title: Basic Strategy for some Simplified Blackjack Variants
abstract:
In this paper, we calculate a basic strategy for several variations of a
simplified version of Blackjack. In short, for these variants the player has
only the two options of hit or stand, and they may only make either decision
once. Other minor variations including rule modifications, changes in number of
decks, alternate payout structures, and different given information about
dealer's hand are also considered. An interesting theoretical result regarding
the asymptotic behavior of the basic strategy and overall expectation as the
number of decks increase is also proved.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Computer Science and Game Theory
